timeline.message:
Bump grpc.version from 1.29.0 to 1.31.0

Bumps `grpc.version` from 1.29.0 to 1.31.0.

Updates `grpc-testing` from 1.29.0 to 1.31.0
- [Release notes](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/compare/v1.29.0...v1.31.0)

Updates `grpc-protobuf` from 1.29.0 to 1.31.0
- [Release notes](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/compare/v1.29.0...v1.31.0)

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Bump grpc.version from 1.29.0 to 1.31.0 (#942)

Removing config variable flowControlWindow due to behavior change in grpc v1.30.0
 - Removed flowControlWindow attribute in NettyProperties
 - The serverBuilder in GrpcConfiguration no longer sets flowControlWindow
 - Removed line mentioning flowControlWindow in configuration.md

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Can you verify the acceptance and performance tests still run.
I believe specifically the Cucumber acceptance tests were affected once in the past when we upgraded the grpc version
See https://github.com/hashgraph/hedera-mirror-node/tree/master/hedera-mirror-test for context  and below for some examples. Feel free to ping me for additional context
Acceptance
./mvnw clean integration-test --projects hedera-mirror-test/ -P=acceptance-tests  -Dcucumber.filter.tags="@Sanity"  -Dspring.config.name=application-perf
Performance
./mvnw clean integration-test --projects hedera-mirror-test/ -P=performance-tests -Djmeter.subscribeThreadCount=1
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Sure, can do.  I think I have the acceptance tests running successfully, the performance tests are still pending some setup.
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText:
Performance testing (against perf):
Topic Message Publish: 500 messages per batch of size 128, 1 thread was successful.
Subscribe only: Pulling 4000 messages, a mixture of historical and incoming, was successful.
I'm playing around with the values, but those tests appear to all be happy.
Sanity Tests (against perf):
Tests run: 4, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
Acceptance Tests:
Tests run: 12, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
replies.author: ijungmann
